page.title: 18GLOSSOPDALE HEALTH CARE (1)
page.content: {The Major Hospital}provision is at Tameside General Hospital about six miles from the town, but there are{ {three small local hospitals.}One of these -{Shirehill}- caters for the elderly and offers rehabilitation courses after disabling illness as well as long term care for the infirm and nursing for the terminally ill. The rehabilitation work is based on a{day centre}opened in 1985. Here patients receive 1.assessment 2.physiotherapy 3.occupational therapy, relearning skills such as cookery to be able to cope at home. Some of the older people remember Shire Hill as the workhouse and are prejudiced against it. {The Partington Hospital,}once the maternity home, nurses elderly orthopaedic patients. (cont.p.19)
